intro: Iria corynocarya, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant red flowers. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Iria corynocarya is often found in rocky areas and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
